note.p: Education: Trinity College, Dublin; BA (1676), MA (1684)
Career: Practised in Dublin, where he had many important patients; after a discreditable love affair, went to London (1686) and thence to the West Indies (1690); died from the effects of intoxication
Memberships: Dublin Philosophical Society; Fellow of the Irish College of Physicians
References: G C R Morris, 'On the Identity of Jaques du Moulin, FRS 1667' in NR 1991 vol 45 pp 1-10
K Theodore Hoppen, 'The Royal Society and Ireland. II' in NR 1965 vol 20 pp 78-99
Notes: Altnames from DNB and Hunter.
